meanings.definition: A member of the nobility or aristocracy in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The eorls gathered for a grand feast in the castle.
meanings.sent2: The eorls held great power and influence in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The eorls decided to have a friendly competition to showcase their skills.
meanings.sent4: The eorls stood tall like ancient oak trees, symbols of strength and tradition.
meanings.sent5: The eorls' luxurious garments shimmered in the sunlight, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Plural form of eorl, referring to multiple members of the nobility or aristocracy in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: Many eorls attended the royal banquet to honor the king.
meanings.sent2: The eorls' loyalty to the crown was unwavering.
meanings.sent3: The eorls' horses raced across the meadow, creating a comical spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The eorls' unity was a shield against any threat to the realm.
meanings.sent5: The eorls' voices echoed through the halls, a chorus of authority and grace.
